content.description: Quality Problem. Sit start up the middle layback/sidepull features. Climb straight up to sculpted tops out holds.
content.location: Siri Boulder; Middle left side of boulder

content.description: On far right side of boulder. Start hands on positive sloping crimps about 4' off ground. Bust a big move up to slope-jug. Find the body position and crank through slopers and pinches to reach the finishing loaf-jug. Fun and quality.

Start sitting in crack sidepulls. Bust a tough squatty move to gain starting holds of Dorsal Loaf Std. then finish up that. The stubborn tree root feels in the way, but it's a good sit start challenge.
Sit Start with left hand in big scoop sidepull and right hand on slopey pocket. Bust a tough move to finish up Clever Knee.
content.location: Sire Boulder; Under Clever Knee~V1 on the left most part of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with hands on side pulls. Climb up to obvious big ear and top out.
content.location: Siri Boulder; First problem on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Start with left hand gastoned in sidepull crimp thats about 5' off the ground and right hand wherever you can reach thats good on the crack feature. Pull on and bust a move up and slightly left to the obvious scoop-fin thing at the top.
content.location: Siri Boulder; This problem is located in the Middle right side of the boulder.

pathTokens: Boulders on Old Wauhatchie Pike, The

content.description: Found by Lookout Mtn Conservancy's Howard School Interns, hidden away under vines, the Siri boulder may be one of the better boulders in the area. It offers good problems at all grades, from V0-V7 and a project or two; a nice height; plus the rock is pretty darn good.
